description: Regions of AAV constructs where mutations should be avoided or carefully considered

exclusion_zones.name: ITR_boundaries
exclusion_zones.rationale: ITR secondary structure is essential for AAV replication and packaging. Mutations near ITR boundaries can disrupt stem-loop formation.
recommendations: Never introduce restriction sites within 10bp of ITR boundaries
Avoid any mutations in this region unless absolutely necessary
If mutations required, verify ITR secondary structure predictions
exclusion_zones.reference: ITR secondary structure is critical for Rep protein binding and genome replication

exclusion_zones.name: Rep68_splice_acceptor
exclusion_zones.region: AAV2 nucleotides 2227-2232 (CCTGCAGG / PstI site) and surrounding context
exclusion_zones.rationale: This region contains a cryptic splice acceptor for Rep68. While not always active in typical AAV expression cassettes, mutations here can activate cryptic splicing in some contexts.
recommendations: Avoid introducing splice consensus sequences (AG dinucleotides) near position 2227-2232 equivalent in your construct
If working with full AAV genome or Rep-containing plasmids, preserve wild-type sequence
For standard transfer plasmids (ITR-only), less critical but still worth noting
exclusion_zones.notes: This is primarily a concern for full AAV genome constructs or those containing Rep/Cap genes. Less relevant for standard ITR-only transfer plasmids.

exclusion_zones.name: Kozak_consensus
exclusion_zones.region: 6bp upstream and 3bp downstream of translation start codon (ATG)
exclusion_zones.rationale: Kozak consensus sequence (GCCACCATGG) affects translation initiation efficiency. Mutations can reduce protein expression.
recommendations: Preserve optimal Kozak when possible: GCC(A/G)CCATGG
Critical positions: -3 (purine, preferably A), +4 (G)
If modifying for restriction site removal, maintain at least -3 A/G and +4 G
Test expression if significantly altering Kozak sequence
exclusion_zones.reference: Kozak consensus sequence for mammalian translation initiation

exclusion_zones.name: polyA_signal
exclusion_zones.rationale: PolyA signal (AATAAA or ATTAAA) and downstream elements are required for proper mRNA 3' end processing. Mutations can cause read-through or premature termination.
recommendations: Never mutate the AATAAA hexamer itself
Preserve sequence context ±30bp around polyA signal
Avoid introducing upstream AATAAA sites (cryptic polyA)
If using synthetic polyA (bGH, SV40), maintain consensus sequence
Consider using well-validated polyA signals (WPRE, bGH, SV40 late)

exclusion_zones.name: splice_sites
exclusion_zones.region: GT-AG dinucleotides in specific contexts (5'ss: GT, 3'ss: AG)
exclusion_zones.rationale: Cryptic splice sites can cause aberrant splicing, especially in constructs with introns or long transgenes.
consequences: Production of truncated or aberrant proteins
recommendations: Avoid creating strong splice consensus sequences: (C/A)AG|GT(A/G)AGT (5'ss) or (C/T)nNCAG|G (3'ss)
If transgene naturally contains introns, use intronless cDNA for AAV
For large transgenes (>2kb), scan for cryptic splice sites and remove via silent mutations
Use splice site prediction tools (MaxEntScan, NNSplice) to identify strong cryptic sites
exclusion_zones.reference: Cryptic splicing in gene therapy vectors, PMID: 11157795

exclusion_zones.name: promoter_core
exclusion_zones.region: TATA box and surrounding 50bp (for TATA-containing promoters)
exclusion_zones.rationale: Core promoter elements (TATA box, Inr, DPE) are critical for transcription initiation. Mutations dramatically affect expression levels.
recommendations: Never mutate core promoter elements (TATA box, Inr, DPE)
Preserve promoter sequence exactly as published/validated
For common promoters (CMV, EF1α, CAG), use exact reference sequences
If removing restriction sites from promoter region, verify activity experimentally

common_promoters.name: CMV immediate early
common_promoters.notes: Strong, ubiquitous. Prone to silencing in some contexts.

common_promoters.name: EF1α
common_promoters.notes: Constitutive, less prone to silencing than CMV

common_promoters.name: CAG (hybrid)
common_promoters.notes: Very strong, combination of CMV enhancer + chicken β-actin promoter

common_promoters.name: U6 (for shRNA)
common_promoters.notes: RNA Pol III promoter, very sensitive to mutations

exclusion_zones.name: regulatory_elements
exclusion_zones.region: Enhancers, silencers, WPRE, and other regulatory sequences
exclusion_zones.rationale: Regulatory elements can dramatically affect transgene expression. Mutations may reduce or eliminate their function.
recommendations: Use exact published sequences for regulatory elements
For WPRE, avoid mutations in structured regions (3' end especially)
If modifying enhancers, consider testing expression empirically
Maintain spacing between regulatory elements and core promoter

common_elements.name: WPRE (Woodchuck Post-transcriptional Regulatory Element)
common_elements.notes: Enhances transgene expression 2-10 fold. Use WPRE3 variant (X protein deleted) for safety. Avoid mutations in 3' structured region.

common_elements.name: CMV enhancer
common_elements.notes: Often combined with other promoters (e.g., CAG = CMV enhancer + chicken β-actin)

exclusion_zones.name: start_codon_context
exclusion_zones.rationale: Context around start codon affects translation initiation. Overlaps with Kozak consensus.
recommendations: Optimize Kozak context (see Kozak_consensus zone)
Avoid upstream ATGs in good Kozak context (can cause N-terminal extension or reduced translation)
If upstream ATG unavoidable, ensure it's in poor Kozak context or out-of-frame

exclusion_zones.name: internal_ribosome_entry_sites
exclusion_zones.rationale: IRES allow cap-independent translation. Highly structured, very sensitive to mutations.
consequences: Reduced or abolished downstream cistron expression
recommendations: Treat IRES sequences as completely immutable
Use exact reference sequences from validated sources
Do not attempt to remove restriction sites from IRES regions
If restriction sites present, use alternative cloning strategy

common_IRES.name: EMCV IRES
common_IRES.notes: Most commonly used. ~600bp. Do not modify.

exclusion_zones.alternative: Consider using 2A peptide sequences instead of IRES for polycistronic expression (more compact, less sensitive to mutations)

general_principles.description: For well-validated elements (promoters, polyA, ITRs), use exact published sequences without modification
Maintain ≥10bp buffer between designed elements and critical regions (ITRs, splice sites, etc.)
If mutations are made in or near exclusion zones, validate expression/function experimentally
When removing restriction sites from coding regions, use only silent mutations and verify with Checkpoint 8
Scan for cryptic splice sites, polyA signals, and start codons. Remove via silent mutations if needed.

tools_and_resources.name: mRNA structure prediction (mfold, RNAfold)
tools_and_resources.purpose: Predict secondary structures that might affect expression

Checkpoint_8.name: Silent Mutation Verification
Checkpoint_8.exclusion_zones_check: Ensure silent mutations are not introduced in exclusion zones (Kozak, promoter core, polyA signal, etc.)

Checkpoint_9.name: Cloning Site Uniqueness
Checkpoint_9.exclusion_zones_check: Verify that restriction sites near ITRs or in exclusion zones are accounted for in uniqueness calculation

Phase_0.name: Project Setup
Phase_0.exclusion_zones_check: Document which exclusion zones are present in chosen backbone and expression elements
